New Records: Andy Ibáñez hit the first go-ahead pinch-hit base hit in postseason history for the Detroit Tigers.
Key Match Events: Tigers' rally in the 8th inning, led by Andy Ibáñez's pinch-hit bases-clearing double, to win the game 5-2.
Tigers' pitcher Tyler Holton led a procession of four relievers through six scoreless innings.
Tigers' manager A.J. Hinch's decision to leave Wenceel Pérez out of the lineup to have him as a matchup-proof pinch-hitter.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers' manager A.J. Hinch's emphasis on 'pitching chaos' and preparing for matchups.
Andy Ibáñez's role in beating left-handed pitching throughout the season.
Post-Match Reflections: Andy Ibáñez's emotional moment after hitting the game-winning double, feeling the connection and togetherness with his teammates.
Tigers' manager A.J. Hinch's pride in the team's resilience and their first postseason series win since 2013.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tigers' first postseason series win since 2013.
Tigers' first playoff win when trailing in the 8th inning since Game 3 of the 1987 ALCS.
Others: Hunter Brown's strong performance, allowing only one run in six innings.
Kerry Carpenter's tying run in the 8th inning.
